reviews.text: We stayed in the Marple room which was well-decorated, very well-maintained and larger than it looked in the website's photos. The bathroom had all the usual amenities and plenty of strong, hot water in the morning.

reviews.text: Breakfast was standard B&B fare; plenty of seating in the dining area. There are no other common areas for guests, but that worked for us.
reviews.title: I think I've discovered I'm more of a hotel girl.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property has free parking in back (the hotels nearby charge $25 and up for parking) and it's easy walking distance to the city center and many restaurants. Benefit Street is lovely to stroll along. We were in town for WaterFire and found this to be a perfect location.
reviews.title: Lovely place, fantastic service--we'll defintely be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a wonderful weekend stay at the Old Court B&B last month and can't wait to go back! The location is fantastic - nestled within the beautiful historic district and within easy walking distance of the universities, RISD museum, and plenty of dining and entertainment options. The B&B itself is very clean and comfortable, with all the modern conveniences, but also captures the wonderful historical character of the building with its period details and unique room themes. The staff was fantastic, very helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed the hearty breakfasts, and the convenience of having tea and coffee self service available at all hours. A very special place overall, I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: A very special place overall, I highly recommend it!

reviews.text: Our getaway girls have traveled the USA for 24 years and found our experience at the Old Court and Providence to be one of the best. Comfortable conditions with a considerate staff and lovely ambiance in a great location. Thanx, Max
reviews.title: Delightful benefits on Benefit Street at the Old Court Inn!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I picked out the Old Court B&B based on it being mentioned on the hplovecraft.com website. Everything about the place definitely met or exceeded our expectations. The neighborhood is absolutely lovely, and the hotel is in close proximity to historical areas and nice restaurants. We stayed in the Empire room downstairs, which we picked out based on the looked just like the picture on the website. Everything was cozy and comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful, they had a nice selection of fruit, bread, and condiments out, and also served eggs and pancakes cooked to order. Everything about our stay was perfect.
reviews.title: Fabulous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: http://www.oldcourt.com/roomDetail.php?room=empire
reviews.title: A great B&B

reviews.text: We arrived in the middle of a blizzard, and were given a warm welcome. Max, our host, supplied all of our needs, and his employees were always helpful and pleasant. The room, including the double bed, was very comfortable. We were in the Empire Room, on the ground floor, which is smaller and more simply furnished than some of the other rooms, but it included all we need for our one-week stay. The home-cooked breakfast was always delicious.
reviews.title: Welcoming & Comfortable

reviews.text: We had to go for some quiet strolls even though the weather was frigid - if we find our way back to this area again - we will consider staying here.

My husband and I spent two nights at the Old Court. Since there were no other guests the first night (midweek in early December), Chris offered us a free upgrade to a larger room. It is an old place but very comfortable. Breakfast was good - omelets, eggs Benedict were offered. The parking lot was small but no problem for us.

reviews.title: Nice B& B in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner is a huge Lovecraft fan, so there was no possible way we could have stayed anywhere else. We wouldn't have wanted to! We stayed in the nightingale room, whch had a fantastic view! The place was historic and gorgeous, and the literary significance made it more special. A fantastic location - we did the Lovecraft walking tour, which was great. Also handy to Brown. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was impressive!
reviews.title: A special place to stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue was a very noisy air conditioner (which we reported and has hopefully since been fixed...?), that did disrupt our sleep a bit.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.text: Location of the Old Court could not be better - close to the historic areas of Providence and within walking distance of many good restaurants. Our room was very comfortable, and the breakfast was great. The staff was extremely helpful. Over all a good choice and excellent value for money!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. My 17 year old stayed there by herself for two weeks to attend a course at RISD. I came up to visit at the end of her stay. It is in a very nice, safe neighborhood. The B&B is ideally located for RISD or Brown University. The breakfast (included) was excellent.
reviews.title: well priced option for providence

reviews.text: I thought this was a decent B&B. It is old-fashioned and has a vintage feel but it basically has everything you need. The breakfast was fine. The location is great - right near Brown and RISD if you are visiting for graduation - walking distance to both.
reviews.title: ideal location, but a bit pricey
